Description: Nile silt pottery bowl with flat base and flaring sides drawing in towards the rim due to smoothing; interior and coated with red slip and burnished. Exterior coated with red wash and body scraped to shape. Base bears potmark incised post-firing of a cross with one additional spoke
Curator's comments: Marked H118 on side. Polished red ware P23c in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
